item.title: Workmen left gaping hole, 10th September
item.description:
A very large hole left by workmen today out side the pub. No barriers or cover. Potential for customers to fall in. We have temporarily covered with a sandbag

item.title: 2 drains blocked with mud and leaves., 10th September
item.description:
2 blocked drains at the junction with Bird in Hand Lane and Page Heath Lane causing pooling of excessive ground water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Centre of Fraser road sinking, 10th September
item.description:
The centre of the road on Fraser Road is sinking down, causing vehicles to pull to the side or scrape along the surface of the road. It also causes larger vehicles such as buses to have to serve to avoid the hole and avoid grounding out. It has been getting deeper and deeper over time and needs repairing before it gives way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting, 10th September
item.description:
Street Light outside 33 Hayesford Park Drive, comes On & Off randomly during both Evening & during Night. Also, area very dark because of tree in garden blocking light from street light near number 39. Been problem for many weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayesford Park Drive, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trailer left and unmoved for weeks, 10th September
item.description:
Trailer left, possibly abandoned in the road for over 2 months. This road has permit parking - is a permit paid for this "vehicle" given it does not have a number plate? It should be off road parked or stored somewhere else. It is blocking natural light in to a number of houses, is taking up multiple parking spaces and is not being used. Please can this be investigated urgently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cliffview Road, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive flytipping at 20 glenarm rd, e5, 10th September
item.description:
Massive flytipping has been ongoing for over a year and getting worse. The rubbish and abandoned household items are now obstructing the public highway. This issue needs to be investigated by Enforcement and addressed as a matter of urgency

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London
